definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Scale is a platitude problem of geomorphology.
sentences.chinese: 尺度是一个老生常谈的地学问题。

sentences.english: The talk is no more than a platitude.
sentences.chinese: 这番话无非是老生常谈。

sentences.english: It makes sense that money can never be brought or taken, as always said.
sentences.chinese: 老生常谈的钱财生不带来死不带去是有道理的。

sentences.english: His speech was full of milk-and-water platitudes.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲尽是些乏味的老生常谈。

sentences.english: Much of what Wen stressed yesterday at the National People's Congress in Beijing is already old hat.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天在北京人代会上所强调的大多是老生常谈。

sentences.english: It is a cliché to say that sport is a metaphor for life.
sentences.chinese: 体育是生活的隐喻，这句话似乎已是老生常谈。

sentences.english: It was a poor performance, full of inconclusive arguments and other commonplaces.
sentences.chinese: 课本不怎么样，尽是不得要领的论说和一些老生常谈。

sentences.english: Numbers are a frequent source of error in writing about science.
sentences.chinese: 科学文章写作过程中，数字也是个老生常谈的问题。

sentences.english: The talk is no more than a platitude.
sentences.chinese: 一度新颖的构思已经成为老生常谈。

sentences.english: I am the champion of the platitude .
sentences.chinese: 我是这种老生常谈的冠军。

sentences.english: A once - original thought that has become a truism.
sentences.chinese: 一度新颖的构思已经成为老生常谈。

sentences.english: It's no more than a platitude.
It is a cliché, of course, but travelling itself is the best education.
sentences.chinese: 当然这是老生常谈，但旅行本身就是最好的教育。

sentences.english: What he has said is a mere commonplace.
sentences.chinese: 他所说的无非是老生常谈而已。

sentences.english: Prevention and treatment of hypertension is the subject of a platitude .
sentences.chinese: 高血压病的防治是一个老生常谈的课题。

sentences.english: This has the makings of a platitude but hear me out.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个老生常谈的话题，但请先听我说完。

definition: to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
to talk about/to mention/(preposition) as for
of the utmost importance/of highest priority
to digress/to get sidetracked/to go off on a tangent
